00021 #include <stdio.h>
00022 #include <stdlib.h>
00023 #include <string.h>
00024 #include <time.h>
00025 
00026 #include "test-harness.h"
00027 
00028 #include "dbprim.h"
00029 #include "dbprim_int.h"
00030 
00031 RCSTAG("@(#)$Id$");
00032 
00033 TEST_PROG(t_hashtab, "Test hash table functionality")
00034 
00035 #define FLUSH_THRESHOLD 10
00036 
00037 /* calculate the hamming weight... */
00038 static unsigned long
00039 hamming(unsigned long bits)
00040 {
00041 #define _hw(n, m, s)    (((n) & (m)) + (((n) >> (s)) & (m)))
00042   bits = _hw(bits, 0x55555555,  1);
00043   bits = _hw(bits, 0x33333333,  2);
00044   bits = _hw(bits, 0x0f0f0f0f,  4);
00045   bits = _hw(bits, 0x00ff00ff,  8);
00046   bits = _hw(bits, 0x0000ffff, 16);
00047 
00048   return bits;
00049 }
00050 
00051 /* simple hash function for testing... */
00052 static unsigned long
00053 t_hash(hash_table_t *tab, db_key_t *key)
00054 {
00055   unsigned long hash = 0;
00056   unsigned char *kv = dk_key(key);
00057   int i;
00058 
00059   if (dk_len(key) < 0) /* if no length... */
00060     dk_len(key) = strlen((char *)dk_key(key)); /* set one! */
00061 
00062   for (i = dk_len(key); i; i--) /* hash the string */
00063     hash += hash * 257 + kv[i];
00064 
00065   return hash; /* return the hash value */
00066 }
00067 
00068 /* simple hash comparison function for testing... */
00069 static unsigned long
00070 t_comp(hash_table_t *tab, db_key_t *key1, db_key_t *key2)
00071 {
00072   if (dk_len(key1) < 0) /* first, fix up the lengths... */
00073     dk_len(key1) = strlen((char *)dk_key(key1));
00074   if (dk_len(key2) < 0)
00075     dk_len(key2) = strlen((char *)dk_key(key2));
00076 
00077   if (dk_len(key1) != dk_len(key2)) /* if lengths don't match... */
00078     return 1; /* then the entries can't possibly match */
00079 
00080   /* use memcmp to do the actual comparison */
00081   return memcmp(dk_key(key1), dk_key(key2), dk_len(key1));
00082 }
00083 
00084 static unsigned int rsize_flags = 0;
00085 
00086 #define RSF_INHIBIT     0x0001
00087 #define RSF_RESIZE      0x0002
00088 
00089 static unsigned long rsize_new = 0;
00090 static unsigned long rsize_err = 44;
00091 
00092 /* simple resize callback function for testing */
00093 static unsigned long
00094 t_resize(hash_table_t *tab, unsigned long new)
00095 {
00096   rsize_new = new; /* save new table size... */
00097   rsize_flags |= RSF_RESIZE; /* mark that it's been resized */
00098 
00099   /* should we inhibit resize? */
00100   return rsize_flags & RSF_INHIBIT ? rsize_err : 0;
00101 }
00102 
00103 static db_key_t keys[] = {
00104   DB_KEY_INIT("one", -1),          DB_KEY_INIT("two", -1),
00105   DB_KEY_INIT("three", -1),        DB_KEY_INIT("four", -1),
00106   DB_KEY_INIT("five", -1),         DB_KEY_INIT("six", -1),
00107   DB_KEY_INIT("seven", -1),        DB_KEY_INIT("eight", -1),
00108   DB_KEY_INIT("nine", -1),         DB_KEY_INIT("ten", -1),
00109   DB_KEY_INIT("eleven", -1),       DB_KEY_INIT("twelve", -1),
00110   DB_KEY_INIT("thirteen", -1),     DB_KEY_INIT("fourteen", -1),
00111   DB_KEY_INIT("fifteen", -1),      DB_KEY_INIT("sixteen", -1),
00112   DB_KEY_INIT("seventeen", -1),    DB_KEY_INIT("eighteen", -1),
00113   DB_KEY_INIT("nineteen", -1),     DB_KEY_INIT("twenty", -1),
00114   DB_KEY_INIT("twenty-one", -1),   DB_KEY_INIT("twenty-two", -1),
00115   DB_KEY_INIT("twenty-three", -1), DB_KEY_INIT("twenty-four", -1),
00116   DB_KEY_INIT("twenty-five", -1),  DB_KEY_INIT("twenty-six", -1),
00117   DB_KEY_INIT("twenty-seven", -1), DB_KEY_INIT("twenty-eight", -1),
00118   DB_KEY_INIT("twenty-nine", -1),  DB_KEY_INIT("thirty", -1)
00119 };
00120 
00121 #define HASH_ENT_CNT    (sizeof(keys) / sizeof(db_key_t))
00122 
00123 static struct moves_s {
00124   int elem;
00125   db_key_t key;
00126 } moves[] = {
00127   {  3, DB_KEY_INIT("thirty-one", -1) },
00128   { 14, DB_KEY_INIT("thirty-two", -1) },
00129   {  6, DB_KEY_INIT("thirty-three", -1) },
00130   { 11, DB_KEY_INIT("thirty-four", -1) },
00131   {  1, DB_KEY_INIT("thirty-five", -1) },
00132   {  4, DB_KEY_INIT("thirty-six", -1) },
00133   { 27, DB_KEY_INIT("thirty-seven", -1) },
00134   { 24, DB_KEY_INIT("thirty-eight", -1) },
00135   { 18, DB_KEY_INIT("thirty-nine", -1) },
00136   { 15, DB_KEY_INIT("forty", -1) }
00137 };
00138 
00139 #define HASH_MOVE_CNT   (sizeof(moves) / sizeof(struct moves_s))
00140 
00141 static int removes[] = { 5, 7, 24, 21, 13, 8, 22 };
00142 
00143 #define HASH_REMOVE_CNT (sizeof(removes) / sizeof(int))
00144 
00145 struct iter_s {
00146   int elem;
00147   unsigned long err;
00148   unsigned long visited;
00149 };
00150 
00151 #define VISIT_INIT      ((1 << HASH_ENT_CNT) - 1)
00152 
00153 static unsigned long
00154 t_iter(hash_table_t *tab, hash_entry_t *ent, struct iter_s *iter)
00155 {
00156   if (iter->elem == (int)he_value(ent)) /* If this is the one we error on... */
00157     return iter->err; /* then error out, dude! */
00158 
00159   /* must be after the error return because the element we're looking at
00160    * might actually be the last element anyway, so if we turned off the
00161    * bit, iter->visited would be zero, and the test would unexpectedly
00162    * fail.
00163    */
00164   iter->visited &= ~(1 << (int)he_value(ent));
00165 
00166   return 0;
00167 }
00168 
00169 int
00170 main(int argc, char **argv)
00171 {
00172   unsigned long err;
00173   hash_table_t tab; /* a hash table to play with... */
00174   hash_entry_t ents[HASH_ENT_CNT]; /* some entries to operate on... */
00175   hash_entry_t *he = 0;
00176   int i, tmp;
00177   unsigned long visited = VISIT_INIT, visit_init = VISIT_INIT;
00178   unsigned long oldsize = 0, newsize = 0;
00179   struct iter_s iter_tmp = { 0, 88, 0 };
00180   int resize_successful = 0;
00181 
00182   srand(time(0)); /* seed random number generator */
00183 
00184   /* OK, let's test ht_init first... */
00185   TEST(t_hashtab, ht_init, "Test that ht_init() may be called",
00186        (!(err = ht_init(&tab, 0, t_hash, t_comp, t_resize, 0, 6)) &&
00187         ht_modulus(&tab) == 7), FATAL(0),
00188        ("ht_init() call successful"),
00189        ("ht_init() call failed with error %lu modulus %lu", err,
00190         ht_modulus(&tab)));
00191 
00192   /* Now let's try some he_init()s... */
00193   TEST_DECL(t_hashtab, he_init, "Test that he_init() may be called")
00194   for (i = 0; i < HASH_ENT_CNT; i++)
00195     if ((err = he_init(&ents[i], (void *)i)))
00196       FAIL(TEST_NAME(he_init), FATAL(0), "he_init() failed with error %lu",
00197            err);
00198   PASS(TEST_NAME(he_init), "he_init() calls successful");
00199 
00200   /* All right, let's add the entries to the hash table. */
00201   TEST_DECL(t_hashtab, ht_add, "Test that ht_add() adds entries to hash table")
00202   for (i = 0; i < HASH_ENT_CNT; i++)
00203     if ((err = ht_add(&tab, &ents[i], &keys[i])))
00204       FAIL(TEST_NAME(ht_add), FATAL(0), "ht_add() failed with error %lu", err);
00205   PASS(TEST_NAME(ht_add), "ht_add() calls successful");
00206 
00207   /* Now let's try a few ht_find() trials... */
00208   TEST_DECL(t_hashtab, ht_find, "Test that ht_find() finds entries in hash "
00209             "table")
00210   for (visited = VISIT_INIT; visited; visited &= ~(1 << tmp)) {
00211     tmp = rand() % HASH_ENT_CNT; /* select an entry at random */
00212     fprintf(stderr, "Looking up entry %d . . .\n", tmp);
00213     if ((err = ht_find(&tab, &he, &keys[tmp])))
00214       FAIL(TEST_NAME(ht_find), FATAL(0), "ht_find() failed with error %lu",
00215            err);
00216     else if (he != &ents[tmp])
00217       FAIL(TEST_NAME(ht_find), FATAL(0), "ht_find() found wrong entry; "
00218            "expected %d returned %d", tmp, he ? -1 : he - ents);
00219   }
00220   PASS(TEST_NAME(ht_find), "ht_find() calls successful");
00221 
00222   /* OK, let's do some ht_move() tests now... */
00223   TEST_DECL(t_hashtab, ht_move, "Test that ht_move() moves entries around")
00224   for (i = 0; i < HASH_MOVE_CNT; i++)
00225     if ((err = ht_move(&tab, &ents[moves[i].elem], &moves[i].key)))
00226       FAIL(TEST_NAME(ht_move), FATAL(0), "ht_move() failed with error %lu",
00227            err);
00228   PASS(TEST_NAME(ht_move), "ht_move() calls successful");
00229 
00230   /* Now move on to ht_remove()... */
00231   TEST_DECL(t_hashtab, ht_remove, "Test that ht_remove() removes entries")
00232   for (i = 0; i < HASH_REMOVE_CNT; i++) {
00233     if ((err = ht_remove(&tab, &ents[removes[i]])))
00234       FAIL(TEST_NAME(ht_remove), FATAL(0), "ht_remove() failed with error %lu",
00235            err);
00236     visit_init &= ~(1 << removes[i]); /* keep track of what's removed */
00237   }
00238   PASS(TEST_NAME(ht_remove), "ht_remove() calls successful");
00239 
00240   /* OK, let's try some ht_iter() tests */
00241   TEST_DECL(t_hashtab, ht_iter, "Test that ht_iter() iterates properly")
00242   for (visited = VISIT_INIT; visited; visited &= ~(1 << iter_tmp.elem)) {
00243     iter_tmp.elem = rand() % HASH_ENT_CNT;
00244     iter_tmp.visited = visit_init;
00245 
00246     fprintf(stderr, "Iterating, ending on element %d (visited 0x%08lx; "
00247             "element mask 0x%08lx)%s\n", iter_tmp.elem, iter_tmp.visited,
00248             (0x01lu << iter_tmp.elem),
00249             !(visit_init & (1 << iter_tmp.elem)) ? " [missing]" : "");
00250 
00251     err = ht_iter(&tab, (hash_iter_t)t_iter, (void *)&iter_tmp);
00252 
00253     fprintf(stderr, "Visited elements 0x%08lx; returned error %lu\n",
00254             iter_tmp.visited, err);
00255 
00256     /* check error return... */
00257     if (err != ((visit_init & (1 << iter_tmp.elem)) ? iter_tmp.err : 0)) {
00258       FAIL(TEST_NAME(ht_iter), 0, "ht_iter() returned unexpected error "
00259            "code %lu", err);
00260       goto iter_fail; /* yeah, yeah, I know; this is just the easiest way */
00261                       /* to get out of this loop and avoid calling PASS   */
00262                       /* that I can think of...                           */
00263     }
00264 
00265     /* Now check visited elements... */
00266     if ((err ? (iter_tmp.visited == 0) : (iter_tmp.visited != 0))) {
00267       FAIL(TEST_NAME(ht_iter), 0, "ht_iter() failed to visit expected items; "
00268            "visited 0x%08lx %c= 0", iter_tmp.visited, err ? '!' : '=');
00269       goto iter_fail; /* yeah, yeah, I know; this is just the easiest way */
00270                       /* to get out of this loop and avoid calling PASS   */
00271                       /* that I can think of...                           */
00272     }
00273   }
00274   PASS(TEST_NAME(ht_iter), "ht_iter() calls successful");
00275  iter_fail:
00276 
00277   /* Now let's check ht_resize()... */
00278   TEST(t_hashtab, ht_resize, "Test that ht_resize() may be called",
00279        (!(err = ht_resize(&tab, 20)) && ht_modulus(&tab) == 23), 0,
00280        ("ht_resize() call successful"),
00281        ("ht_resize() call failed with error %lu modulus %lu", err,
00282         ht_modulus(&tab)));
00283 
00284   /* remember if ht_resize worked... */
00285   if (!err && ht_modulus(&tab) == 23)
00286     resize_successful = 1;
00287 
00288   /* OK, let's try some flushing... */
00289   TEST_DECL(t_hashtab, ht_flush, "Test that ht_flush() flushes the table")
00290   for (visited = visit_init; visited; ) {
00291     iter_tmp.elem = rand() % HASH_ENT_CNT; /* select an element */
00292 
00293     /* are we ready to actually clean the whole thing? */
00294     if (!(visited & (1 << iter_tmp.elem)) &&
00295         hamming(visited) >= FLUSH_THRESHOLD)
00296       continue; /* select another element */
00297 
00298     iter_tmp.visited = visited; /* figure out what we visited... */
00299 
00300     fprintf(stderr, "Flushing, ending on element %d (visited 0x%08lx; "
00301             "element mask 0x%08lx; hamming %lu)%s\n", iter_tmp.elem,
00302             iter_tmp.visited, (0x01lu << iter_tmp.elem),
00303             hamming(iter_tmp.visited),
00304             !(visited & (1 << iter_tmp.elem)) ? " [missing]" : "");
00305 
00306     err = ht_flush(&tab, (hash_iter_t)t_iter, (void *)&iter_tmp);
00307 
00308     fprintf(stderr, "Visited elements 0x%08lx; returned error %lu\n",
00309             iter_tmp.visited, err);
00310 
00311     /* check error return... */
00312     if (err != ((visited & (1 << iter_tmp.elem)) ? iter_tmp.err : 0))
00313       FAIL(TEST_NAME(ht_flush), FATAL(0), "ht_flush() returned unexpected "
00314            "error code %lu", err);
00315     if (err ? (iter_tmp.visited == 0) : (iter_tmp.visited != 0))
00316       FAIL(TEST_NAME(ht_flush), FATAL(0), "ht_flush() failed to visit "
00317            "expected items; visited 0x%08lx %c= 0", iter_tmp.visited,
00318            err ? '!' : '=');
00319 
00320     /* update what's been flushed out... */
00321     visited &= iter_tmp.visited & ~(1 << iter_tmp.elem);
00322   }
00323   if (ht_count(&tab) == 0)
00324     PASS(TEST_NAME(ht_flush), "ht_flush() properly flushed the table");
00325   else
00326     FAIL(TEST_NAME(ht_flush), FATAL(0), "ht_flush() seems to have left "
00327          "items?");
00328 
00329   TEST(t_hashtab, ht_free, "Test that ht_free() may be called",
00330        (!(err = ht_free(&tab)) && !tab.ht_table), FATAL(0),
00331        ("ht_free() call successful"),
00332        ("ht_free() call failed with error %lu", err));
00333 
00334   if (!resize_successful) /* if resize didn't succeed... */
00335     return 0; /* well, there's no point testing AUTOGROW/AUTOSHRINK */
00336 
00337   /* allow automatic growing/shrinking */
00338   ht_flags(&tab) |= HASH_FLAG_AUTOGROW | HASH_FLAG_AUTOSHRINK;
00339 
00340   /* OK, do some tests with auto-growing... */
00341   TEST_DECL(t_hashtab, ht_add_autogrow, "Test that ht_add() automatically "
00342             "grows the table")
00343   for (i = 0; i < HASH_ENT_CNT; i++) {
00344     oldsize = ht_modulus(&tab); /* save old size... */
00345     rsize_flags = RSF_INHIBIT; /* inhibit the growth... */
00346 
00347     fprintf(stderr, "Adding element %d\n", i);
00348 
00349     err = ht_add(&tab, &ents[i], &keys[i]); /* add the entry */
00350 
00351     /* Now, check for errors... */
00352     if (ht_modulus(&tab) != oldsize)
00353       FAIL(TEST_NAME(ht_add_autogrow), FATAL(0), "ht_add() grew the table "
00354            "when callback prohibited it");
00355     if (err != ((rsize_flags & RSF_RESIZE) ? rsize_err : 0))
00356       FAIL(TEST_NAME(ht_add_autogrow), FATAL(0), "ht_add() failed with error "
00357            "code %lu", err);
00358 
00359     if (rsize_flags & RSF_RESIZE) { /* ok, resize callback called... */
00360       fprintf(stderr, "Element %d: ht_add() autogrow to %lu\n", i, rsize_new);
00361       if (rsize_new <= oldsize) /* size make sense? */
00362         FAIL(TEST_NAME(ht_add_autogrow), FATAL(0), "ht_add() wants to "
00363              "shrink the table? (New size %lu, old size %lu)", rsize_new,
00364              oldsize);
00365 
00366       rsize_flags = 0; /* turn off inhibition */
00367       newsize = rsize_new; /* save new size */
00368 
00369       if ((err = ht_add(&tab, &ents[i], &keys[i]))) /* try now... */
00370         FAIL(TEST_NAME(ht_add_autogrow), FATAL(0), "ht_add() failed with "
00371              "error code %lu during autogrow", err);
00372 
00373       /* OK, check the size... */
00374       if (ht_modulus(&tab) != newsize)
00375         FAIL(TEST_NAME(ht_add_autogrow), FATAL(0), "ht_add() tried to resize "
00376              "to a random value; expecting %lu, got %lu (original %lu, "
00377              "callback %lu)",
00378              newsize, ht_modulus(&tab), oldsize, rsize_new);
00379     }
00380   }
00381   PASS(TEST_NAME(ht_add_autogrow), "ht_add() autogrows the table properly");
00382 
00383   /* Do some more ht_find() trials to make certain the table makes sense */
00384   TEST_DECL(t_hashtab, ht_find_autogrow, "Test that ht_find() can still "
00385             "find entries for autogrow")
00386   for (visited = VISIT_INIT; visited; visited &= ~(1 << tmp)) {
00387     tmp = rand() % HASH_ENT_CNT; /* select an entry at random */
00388     fprintf(stderr, "Looking up entry %d . . .\n", tmp);
00389     if ((err = ht_find(&tab, &he, &keys[tmp])))
00390       FAIL(TEST_NAME(ht_find_autogrow), FATAL(0), "ht_find() failed with "
00391            "error %lu", err);
00392     else if (he != &ents[tmp])
00393       FAIL(TEST_NAME(ht_find_autogrow), FATAL(0), "ht_find() found wrong "
00394            "entry; returned %d expected %d", he ? -1 : he - ents, tmp);
00395   }
00396   PASS(TEST_NAME(ht_find_autogrow), "ht_find() calls successful on "
00397        "automatically grown table");
00398 
00399   /* Now, do some ht_remove() trials with autoshrink enabled... */
00400   TEST_DECL(t_hashtab, ht_remove_autoshrink, "Test that ht_remove() "
00401             "automatically shrinks the table")
00402   for (visit_init = VISIT_INIT; ht_count(&tab) > HASH_ENT_CNT / 2;
00403        visit_init &= ~(1 << tmp)) {
00404     tmp = rand() % HASH_ENT_CNT;
00405 
00406     if (!(visit_init & (1 << tmp))) /* element's already been removed */
00407       continue;
00408 
00409     oldsize = ht_modulus(&tab); /* save old size... */
00410     rsize_flags = RSF_INHIBIT; /* inhibit the growth... */
00411 
00412     fprintf(stderr, "Removing element %d\n", tmp);
00413 
00414     err = ht_remove(&tab, &ents[tmp]); /* remove the entry */
00415 
00416     /* Now, check for errors... */
00417     if (ht_modulus(&tab) != oldsize)
00418       FAIL(TEST_NAME(ht_remove_autoshrink), FATAL(0), "ht_remove() shrank the "
00419            "table when callback prohibited it");
00420     if (err != ((rsize_flags & RSF_RESIZE) ? rsize_err : 0))
00421       FAIL(TEST_NAME(ht_remove_autoshrink), FATAL(0), "ht_remove() failed "
00422            "with error code %lu", err);
00423 
00424     if (rsize_flags & RSF_RESIZE) { /* ok, resize callback called... */
00425       fprintf(stderr, "Element %d: ht_remove() autoshrink to %lu\n", tmp,
00426               rsize_new);
00427       if (rsize_new >= oldsize) /* size make sense? */
00428         FAIL(TEST_NAME(ht_remove_autoshrink), FATAL(0), "ht_remove() wants to "
00429              "grow the table? (New size %lu, old size %lu)", rsize_new,
00430              oldsize);
00431 
00432       rsize_flags = 0; /* turn off inhibition */
00433       newsize = rsize_new; /* save new size */
00434 
00435       if ((err = ht_remove(&tab, &ents[tmp]))) /* try now... */
00436         FAIL(TEST_NAME(ht_remove_autogrow), FATAL(0), "ht_remove() failed "
00437              "with error code %lu during autoshrink", err);
00438 
00439       /* OK, check the size... */
00440       if (ht_modulus(&tab) != newsize)
00441         FAIL(TEST_NAME(ht_remove_autoshrink), FATAL(0), "ht_remove() tried "
00442              "to resize to a random value; expecting %lu, got %lu "
00443              "(original %lu, callback %lu)", newsize, ht_modulus(&tab),
00444              oldsize, rsize_new);
00445     }
00446   }
00447   PASS(TEST_NAME(ht_remove_autoshrink), "ht_remove() autoshrinks the table "
00448        "properly");
00449 
00450   /* And last, but certainly not least, do some more ht_find() trials */
00451   TEST_DECL(t_hashtab, ht_find_autoshrink, "Test that ht_find() can still "
00452             "find entries for autoshrink")
00453   for (visited = visit_init; visited; visited &= ~(1 << tmp)) {
00454     tmp = rand() % HASH_ENT_CNT; /* select an entry at random */
00455     if (!(visit_init & (1 << tmp))) /* if it's been removed... */
00456       continue; /* well, skip it! */
00457     fprintf(stderr, "Looking up entry %d . . .\n", tmp);
00458     if ((err = ht_find(&tab, &he, &keys[tmp])))
00459       FAIL(TEST_NAME(ht_find_autoshrink), FATAL(0), "ht_find() failed with "
00460            "error %lu", err);
00461     else if (he != &ents[tmp])
00462       FAIL(TEST_NAME(ht_find_autoshrink), FATAL(0), "ht_find() found wrong "
00463            "entry; returned %d expected %d", he ? -1 : he - ents, tmp);
00464   }
00465   PASS(TEST_NAME(ht_find_autoshrink), "ht_find() calls successful on "
00466        "automatically shrunk table");
00467 
00468   return 0;
00469 }
